text: in the OpenCV documentation , Parameters for polylines:-->  img – Image. pts – Array of polygonal curves.          #SO WHY ARE WE USING LIST "[pts]" ? ## i've tried passing pts it gives an error                                                                     #please explain this  "Traceback (most recent call last):   File "drawingonimgs.py", line 11, in <module>     cv2.polylines(img,pts,True,(0,255,255),300) cv2.error: D:\Build\OpenCV\opencv-3.3.0\modules\imgproc\src\drawing.cpp:2432: error: (-215) p.checkVector(2, CV_32S) >= 0 in function cv::polylines"  npts – Array of polygon vertex counters. ncontours – Number of curves. isClosed – Flag indicating whether the drawn polylines are closed or not. If they are closed, the function draws a line from the last vertex of each curve to its first vertex. color – Polyline color. thickness – Thickness of the polyline edges. lineType – Type of the line segments. See the line() description. shift – Number of fractional bits in the vertex coordinates.
